roleset.name: cause to stop

example.name: arg1 as pro-controlled S
example.text: Moreover, Suez-1 had just finished *PRO*-1 winning an even larger battle last year for control of Societe Generale de Belgique.
example.arg: *PRO*-1 winning an even larger battle last year for control of Societe Generale de Belgique

example.name: with an agentive intentional finisher
example.text: The Senate's public gallery was packed with Judge Hastings' supporters , who erupted into applause after he finished his argument.

example.name: Adjectival rel: finished
example.text: It was a pathetic display and in the end my patience was finished so I walked on stage and gave a little reminder of what Memorial Day is actually about .

roleset.note: Frames file for 'finish' based on sentences in financial subcorpus; adjectival 'finished' based on BOLT-4,5. Member of Vncls stop-55.4-1.

roleset.name: terminate

role.descr: MNR up, down, or unchanged, or degree of change

example.name: manner and extent
example.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which had jumped 41.60 points on Tuesday, drifted on either side of its previous close and finished with a gain of just 0.82 at 2645.90.
example.arg: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which had jumped 41.60 points on Tuesday,

roleset.note: in WSJ corpus, primarily of stocks.

roleset.name: apply a finish, as to wood

example.name: all args
example.text: John finished his new armoire in a lovely shade of chartreuse.
example.arg: in a lovely shade of chartreuse

roleset.name: to bring (a project) to completion

example.name: Journalism
example.text: It could be that they-1 're not actually involved in [*PRO*-1]-2 finishing up *PRO*-2 writing one of the opinions.

roleset.note: See VNcls stop-55.4-1, but verb particle construction isn't present in class.

roleset.name: finish completely

example.name: Eliminate
example.text: Congratulations for *PRO* having Peres , and shalom to you from Sharon whose health you pray for *T*-1 so he can finish off what *ICH*-3 *T*-2 remains of Hamas .

roleset.note: Frame file for 'finish off' based on instances in Webtext 2.5. No VerbNet entry. Comparison to finish.01. Framed by Claire

example.text: [I]-1'd like *PRO*-1 to finish out until my actual retirement when I was ready to quit but, yeah, I have some doubts.
example.arg: until my actual retirement when I was ready to quit
